result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrill J. Hintz

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on December 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.

2:31 PM Defendant Terrill J. Hintz in court.  Attorney Oren Jakobson in court for Terrill J. Hintz.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls the case.
ADA Dodge states the appearances.

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Court questions Atty Jakobson with regards to holding a PreTrial Conference prior to the Preliminary Hearing.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 
PTCD Sheet to indicate if a preliminary hearing will need to be held.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Initial Appearance set for 10/10/22 @ 2:30 p.m. in Br 3
DEFENDANT REFUSED TO SIGN THE $1,000 SIGNATURE BOND

Follow all bond conditions of his open cases.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

2:02 PM Defendant Terrill J Hintz appeared by video, in custody.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Maxwell Bergner appears on behalf of the defendant.
Attorney     appears on behalf of the defendant.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) states facts for anticipated charges of  Possess Methamphetamine . 
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant   is eligible for public defender representation.
State requests a signature bond with conditions as stated. 

Attorney for the defendant does not have any objections as to bond.
Hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
